name: Cracks
description: Tachyon radiation poisoning, phasing, and degradation are only a few of the issues plaguing transplants to present as temporal maladies are on the rise. But could answers to the anomaly crisis lie in their cure?
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Zero Hour Archer, any version of Phlox, Sphere-Builder, Antaak, Temporal Agents, or Star Trek Enterprise crew will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Zero Hour Archer, Phlox, Sphere-Builder, Antaak, Temporal Agents, or Star Trek Enterprise crew
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Grat
featured_crew.flavor: This Tandaran officer has no intention of letting Captain Archer leap away - not when he might have intel on the Cabal.

action.name: Your Curiosity Almost Got You Killed

featured_crew.name: Sphere-Builder
featured_crew.flavor: Promised freedom in exchange for participating in an experiment, this Sphere Builder learned that his only freedom might come in complete cellular degradation.

action.name: When The Xindi Destroy Earth, My People Will Prevail

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Phlox
rewards.flavor: Chief Medical Officer of the Enterprise, Phlox was a lifelong learner of every medical art.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Grat
rewards.flavor: This Tandaran officer has no intention of letting Captain Archer leap away - not when he might have intel on the Cabal.

action.name: Your Curiosity Almost Got You Killed

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

adventures.name: Beam Me Out
adventures.description: Evaluate cases of people who are beamed outside time.

adventures.name: Infection
adventures.description: Document cases of maladies not native to the present.

adventures.name: Like Sands in an Hourglass
adventures.description: Review cases of those experiencing molecular degradation.

adventures.name: Chrono Cracks
adventures.description: Discover spreading temporal maladies and their treatments.

rewards.name: Cracks
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Sphere-Builder
rewards.flavor: Promised freedom in exchange for participating in an experiment, this Sphere Builder learned that his only freedom might come in complete cellular degradation.

action.name: When The Xindi Destroy Earth, My People Will Prevail

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Detect the displaced diseases with the Dominion.

potential_rewards.name: Dominion Transmission
potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Dominion faction missions.

potential_rewards.name: Credits
potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

goals.flavor: Finance a cure with the Ferengi Alliance.

screens.text: "Greetings, Captain. Good of you to answer my hails. As you can see, I have a somewhat reluctant patient in my care. Unfortunately, he's one of many."

"He is right. We have been seeing a rash of maladies I can only call temporal in nature.  Tachyon radiation poisoning. Phasing. A rash of Klingons insisting they are caught between two points in time. And something tells me the ramblings of this being are not wholly symptomatic."

"You haven't the tools to treat me. And my own kind have cast me aside. A prisoner fit only for testing the viability of existing here. But there are more pressing matters you should concern yourselves with. These temporal maladies are not merely Sphere Builder interference."
"Greetings, Captain. Good of you to answer my hails. As you can see, I have a somewhat reluctant patient in my care. Unfortunately, he's one of many."

"He is right. We have been seeing a rash of maladies I can only call temporal in nature.  Tachyon radiation poisoning. Phasing. A rash of Klingons insisting they are caught between two points in time. And something tells me the ramblings of this being are not wholly symptomatic."

"You haven't the tools to treat me. And my own kind have cast me aside. A prisoner fit only for testing the viability of existing here. But there are more pressing matters you should concern yourselves with. These temporal maladies are not merely Sphere Builder interference."
"You've managed to gather some interesting information, Captain. This certainly fills in some holes, though unfortunately, it also appears worse than we feared, Phlox."

"It would seem you are right. Look, the Captain even brought us a case of someone being caught between the present and the prehistoric era on Earth. Fascinating! Ah, but yes, taken as a whole, the rise in temporal maladies is worse than anything we've seen."

responses.text: "I'm assuming these maladies aren't a mere byproduct of the anomaly crisis?"
"Any chance these maladies could be intentional?"
"Really convenient you to just happen to be on the comm channel for this, Quark."

screens.text: "Did I hear someone say temporal maladies? Might I be able to interest you fine medical professionals in some advanced medicine I recently acquired? I hear it's perfect for treating temporal maladies. Something about tachyons or chronitons or what have you. Real top grade stuff!"

"We certainly have seen our fair share since the crisis began, but nothing on the scope or suddenness of this recent outbreak. Across quadrants, species, factions - even the time period individuals come from offers us little correlation."

"That's a question our scientists have been exploring as well. But as I'm sure the good doctor would tell you, the lack of common factors between patients and their maladies makes that difficult to say."

"What are you implying, Captain? That I was hacking and eavesdropping on the communications of certain medical professionals!? The nerve, Captain. Why, I should sue you for this tawdry attempt to damage my pristine reputation!"

"While our Ferengi friend's offer is a tempting one, I find it unwise to pursue without thorough investigation. I'd rather avoid a case where trying to cure someone who is slightly out of phase ends up with lethal helical trauma. Care to assist, Captain?"
"You've managed to gather some interesting information, Captain. This certainly fills in some holes, though unfortunately, it also appears worse than we feared, Phlox."

"It would seem you are right. Look, the Captain even brought us a case of someone being caught between the present and the prehistoric era on Earth. Fascinating! Ah, but yes, taken as a whole, the rise in temporal maladies is worse than anything we've seen."

"Any chance these maladies could be intentional?"
"Really convenient you to just happen to be on the comm channel for this, Quark."
